places_to_visit.name: Machu Picchu
places_to_visit.description: Machu Picchu is an ancient Incan city set high in the Andes Mountains. It was built in the 15th century by the Inca emperor Pachacuti and later abandoned during the Spanish Conquest. The site is renowned for its sophisticated dry-stone construction, terraced fields, and panoramic views.

places_to_visit.name: Cusco
places_to_visit.description: Cusco, the historic capital of the Inca Empire, is known for its well-preserved colonial architecture and Incan ruins. Key sites include the Plaza de Armas, Sacsayhuamán fortress, and Qorikancha temple.

places_to_visit.name: Sacred Valley
places_to_visit.description: The Sacred Valley is a region in the Andes known for its picturesque landscapes and significant archaeological sites. It includes ancient ruins such as Ollantaytambo and Pisac, and is the gateway to Machu Picchu.
